column4: Q: Do we all get the compiz -- replace issue, or is it just me?
You never have to replace your GUI?
how do you mean by gui....?
Sorry not the gui, just the window buttons.
I think you have never had the issue, it's a little odd to explain what happens.
there is emerald which you can apply themes to very easily
changing the buttons sounds a LOT like theming, wouldn't you say. Try giving details and we may be able to help
It's not changing the buttons, it's when the buttons dissapear, & you are not able to move the window. Nor close it, or minimize, you have to replace them with compiz - -replace. Not the same at all.
you should have said THAT first, rather than "You never have to replace your GUI?"  which is absolutely nothing to do with your issue
compiz isn't even a GUI, its a window manager
That is exactly what I  said at first. I wasn't talking about theming, I said the compiz - - replace issue...
I suggest you use the startup items manager and add a new item to run:  compiz --replace     and it will be fine
fyi, you CAN move windows without window decorators, if you hold ALT you can drag an application window from any place in the app
